Ukrainian forces have recaptured the village of Kindrativka, Khotin direction, Sumy Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~862.
Total land area: ~3.95km¬≤.
A massive explosion has occurred in the town of Al-Fu'ah, Idlib Governorate, northwestern Syria. Reports suggest that it is from an ammunition depot.
A massive explosion has occurred in the town of Al-Fu'ah, Idlib Governorate, northwestern Syria. Reports suggest that it is from an ammunition depot.

Update on the Thai-Cambodian conflict. 
The Thai military has launched what they call "Operation Yuttha Bodin", aimed at combatting Cambodian forces in response to their "military actions".
Under heavy artillery cover, Thai forces launched an incursion across the international border with Cambodia, capturing the Preah Vihear Temple and the border crossing point on Highway 62. It's unclear if Thai forces were able to enter the heavily fortified Cambodian trench line defending the temple's eastern flank. Cambodia is now shelling these occupied positions with artillery. 
Thai reinforcements are reportedly moving towards the border along highway 4120 (around 33km east of this initial incursion), with Cambodian sources reporting that their artillery shelling in the region targeted them. 
Mass evacuations of civilians in border provinces in both Cambodia and Thailand are underway. Additionally, a new Thai airstrike was carried out by an F-16 on Cambodian positions south of the Ta Muen Thom Temple, near the international border.\

Updated list of countries/states that twitter users are automatically top experts on:
Ukraine
Russia
Israel
Gaza
Sudan
Lebanon
Iran
Yemen 
Armenia

South Korea

Cambodia
Exhibit 1:

Clashes on the Cambodian-Thai border have continued into the second day, although are not as heavy as before. Mutual artillery shelling and clashes with light weapons continues, and drones are now being employed to drop explosives on positions. 
Additionally, both sides are bringing in further reinforcements to the border area. Cambodia has begun deploying Anti-Aircraft guns, while Thailand continues to deploy armoured vehicles.
Media 4 shows a destroyed Cambodian BM-21 Grad MLRS.

Clashes on the Cambodian-Thai border have continued into the second day, although are not as heavy as before. Mutual artillery shelling and clashes with light weapons continues, and drones are now being employed to drop explosives on positions. 
Additionally, both sides are bringing in further reinforcements to the border area. Cambodia has begun deploying Anti-Aircraft guns, while Thailand continues to deploy armoured vehicles.
Media 4 shows a destroyed Cambodian BM-21 Grad MLRS.

Russian forces have captured the village of Horikhove, Novopavlivka direction, Donetsk Oblast. 
Pre-war population: ~397.
Total land area: ~1.34km¬≤.
Muravka is now the only village left that Russia is yet to capture in the area of Donetsk Oblast directly east of Novopavlivka.
8 HIMARS rockets to Donetsk City.
8 HIMARS rockets to Donetsk City.
Russian S-300/400 air defence is active.
Impact(s) in Kyivskyi District of Donetsk City.
Impact(s) in Kyivskyi District of Donetsk City.

In the Khotin direction, Ukrainian forces continue to advance and have completed the capture of the village of Kindrativka.
After establishing control over the central part of the village, Russian forces advanced southeast from the centre and south from the northeastern houses towards the southeastern part of the village. Russian forces began a gradual withdrawal from this section of the village, resulting in its capture shortly afterwards. 
+ ~5.24km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.
The Green Belt in 2025 compared to 2024
The Green Belt in 2025 compared to 2024

Russian forces have recaptured the village of Mykolaivka, Pokrovsk direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~364. 
Total land area: ~0.56km¬≤.

Night of Escalation: Russia and Ukraine Exchanged Heavy Strikes After Negotiations
The night of July 23-24, 2025 witnessed a dramatic escalation in hostilities as Russian and Ukrainian forces launched simultaneous waves of strikes in each other‚Äôs rear regions. The strikes followed another round of negotiations between the two sides in Istanbul. The exchange highlighted both sides‚Äô growing reliance on long-range precision strikes and drone warfare, with significant blows dealt to military and energy infrastructure.
Russian forces conducted another coordinated assault across Ukraine, employing a mix of high-precision weapons including Iskander-K cruise missiles and Geran-2 kamikaze drones. The strikes focused on crippling Ukraine‚Äôs military-industrial capacity and energy infrastructure supporting frontline operations.
According to the Air Force of Ukraine, in total 103 UAVs, 4 Iskander-K missiles targeted Ukrainian territory at night. 
üëâ

Military Situation In Syria On July 24, 2025 (Map Update)

In Video: Thai Army Attacks Cambodian Military Posts With Drones
The Thai military has begun to use grenade-dropping multirotor drones in the ongoing clashes with the Cambodian military.
The clashes broke out on July 24 morning following tensions over mine explosions that wounded several Thai troops in the Thai province of Ubon Ratchathani. The violence began at the ancient, disputed Ta Muen Thom temple site in the Thai province of Surin, which was claimed by Cambodia, before spreading out to other border areas.
The situation escalated after the Cambodian military fired Grad 122 mm rockets at a gas station in the town of Ban Phue in the Thai province of Sisaket. The Thai Health Ministry said that at least 11 civilians were killed.
In response, F-16 fighter jets of the Thai air force attacked two Cambodian regional military headquarters. Video footage showing one of the strikes was posted to social networks.
üëâ

Iran Replaced Air Defenses Damaged During War With Israel
Iran has replaced air defenses damaged during last month‚Äôs conflict with Israel, Iran‚Äôs Defah Press news agency reported on July 20, quoting Rear Admiral Mahmoud Mousavi, the military‚Äôs deputy for operations.
Iran‚Äôs air defense network was badly hit during the 12-day war. Commandos of the Mossad spy agency did most of the damage, attacking air defense systems from within Iranian territories with small drones and guided missiles.
Despite losing multiple large drones, the Israeli Air Force was able to gain aerial superiority over the western and central parts of the Islamic Republic, including the capital of Tehran.
‚ÄúSome of our air defenses were damaged, this is not something we can hide, but our colleagues have used domestic resources and replaced them with pre-arranged systems that were stored in suitable locations in order to keep the airspace secure,‚Äù Mousavi said
üëâ

Brutal Killings And Torture: Testimonies Of Russian Military Personnel Freed From Ukrainian Captivity
The ‚ÄúInternational Public Tribunal on Crimes of Ukrainian Neo-Nazis‚Äù, comprising human rights defenders and lawyers from 35 countries, regularly publishes testimonies of Russian servicemen returned from Ukrainian captivity. These accounts describe systematic war crimes by the Armed Forces of Ukraine against prisoners of war, which have become routine practices: murders, sophisticated torture methods, and deliberate cruel treatment. These testimonies constitute evidence of gross violations of the Geneva Conventions.
For instance, Russian serviceman with the callsign "Shukher" describes ritualized violence within the Azov Battalion: forced stripping, beatings with batons, use of whips tipped with metal tips, and dog attacks. Additionally, Ukrainian fighters employed electric chair torture and asphyxiation techniques (including with ‚Äúplastic bags‚Äù)...
üëâ
